# Transmute Mud to Rock (Spell)
## Overview
[[Transmutation Spells|Transmutation]] \[[[Earth Spells|earth]]]

**Level:** [[5th Level Druid Spells|Druid 5]], [[5th Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 5]], [[5th Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 5]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 10th-Level Druid Spells List|Druid 10]], [[BoXM 9th-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 9]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S, M/DF (sand, lime, and water)

**Range:** Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)

**Area:** Up to two 10-ft. cubes/level (S)

**Duration:** Permanent

**Saving Throw:** See text

**Spell Resistance:** No

**Source:** PF Core Rulebook, pg. 361

This spell permanently transforms normal mud or quicksand of any depth into soft stone (sandstone or a similar mineral). 

Any creature in the mud is allowed a Reflex save to escape before the area is hardened to stone.

*Transmute mud to rock* counters and dispels *[[Transmute Rock to Mud (Spell)|transmute rock to mud]]*.

**GM Note**

*Spell Secret:* It is possible to make rock (stone) that is considerably more dense (and possibly more valuable) than sandstone. Use the following table to determine the difficulty of the [[Spellcraft (Skill)|Spellcraft]] check and the type and amount of stone produced:


| **Spellcraft DC** | **Type of Stone** | **Amount produced per 2 10-ft cubes of mud** |
|---|---|---|
| 35 | Limestone | 1 10' ft cube |
| 40 | Marble | 1 5' ft. cube |
| 45 | Granite | 1 2.5' ft. cube |
| 50 | Basalt | 1 1' ft. cube |
